importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on this day, and its later appearance and fire at a junkyard are tied to her disappearance.

The remains of Kada Scott were found on this date behind an abandoned school. This marks the resolution of a missing persons case after two weeks of investigation and a new tip leading to the discovery of her remains.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This time frame includes the period during which Kada Scott was missing and when the stolen vehicle (Hyundai Accent) was seen at a recreation center. It also includes the period when the vehicle was later reported on fire, indicating possible connection to the case.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for about two weeks, were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
An anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the site where they had previously searched, resulting in the discovery of her remains in a shallow grave.
DNA testing confirmed Kada Scott’s identity.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, and conspiracy.
King’s cellphone was found in locations related to Scott’s disappearance, and video evidence shows the vehicle he was linked to was seen at a recreation center on the night she went missing.
A black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen a day before Scott went missing and was later found on fire at a junkyard, where it was compacted before examination.
Prosecutors say King had cellphone contact with Scott and that the vehicle used in the case was stolen and later destroyed, raising suspicion of involvement in her disappearance.
Authorities believe others may have been involved after the fact, and investigations into additional perpetrators are ongoing.
District Attorney Larry Krasner stated that homicide charges are expected, but only after following due legal process.
King had previously been arrested in a similar kidnapping case where charges were dropped due to non-appearance of victims and witnesses.
Kada Scott was remembered by her parents as a source of 'light, kindness, and beautiful spirit,' and they expressed deep emotional pain over her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who went missing from Philadelphia after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the missing person whose remains were found behind an abandoned school, marking the resolution of a high-profile missing persons case with significant public and emotional impact.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect linked to Kada Scott’s disappearance through cellphone contact, vehicle activity, and prior criminal history, making him central to the investigation and public attention.

namedEntities.name: Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A black compact car reported stolen one day before Kada Scott disappeared.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The vehicle was seen at a recreation center on the night of her disappearance and later found on fire, suggesting possible involvement in the case or a cover-up, linking it to the timeline of events.

namedEntities.name: Abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which the remains of Kada Scott were found.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as the site of discovery, indicating a possible place where Scott was hidden or where King may have disposed of her body, and is a key physical location in the case.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The prosecutor leading the investigation into Kada Scott’s case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly confirmed the expected homicide charges and emphasized adherence to legal procedures, adding authority and transparency to the prosecution's stance.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided updates on evidence, including cellphone activity and video footage.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She detailed key investigative leads—such as King’s phone location and video evidence—that support the case against him and show the strength of the prosecution’s case.

namedEntities.name: Shaka Johnson
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was contacted by authorities after King’s arrest, indicating legal representation and a potential avenue for defense or appeal.

namedEntities.name: Parents of Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Family members who publicly expressed grief and loss following her disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Their statements humanize the case and reflect the emotional toll of missing persons, increasing public empathy and awareness of the tragedy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, a woman reported missing in Philadelphia after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, were discovered behind an abandoned school. An anonymous tip prompted investigators to re-examine the site, where they found her remains in a shallow grave, confirmed by DNA testing. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and other offenses. Evidence including cellphone location data and video footage of a stolen black Hyundai Accent—seen at a recreation center the night she went missing—links King to her disappearance. The vehicle later caught fire and was destroyed at a junkyard, raising suspicion. Prosecutors believe others may have been involved and are still investigating. While homicide charges are expected, District Attorney Larry Krasner emphasized legal procedures. King has a prior criminal record involving a similar kidnapping case, which was dropped due to lack of witness appearance. Scott’s parents described her as a source of kindness and light, and their grief underscores the personal impact of the case.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
